revised_title: Anisotropy of Electron-Impurity Scattering in Metals: Application to Gold
tldr: The authors used the de Haas-van Alphen effect to study the anisotropy of electron-impurity scattering in metals, focusing on gold. They created topographic maps to show the variation of electronic lifetimes over the Fermi surface due to the presence of different impurities. This method allowed them to directly measure local values of the electronic lifetimes and understand the scattering behavior of electrons in gold.
